description: Van Buren- Philip J. Marquis, 79, passed away unexpectedly Friday, May 29, 2020, while in the arms of his loving wife. Phil was born April 29, 1941, in Van Buren, a son of the late George and Antoinette Marquis. He is survived by his beloved wife of almost 55 years, Leona Marquis of Van Buren; two sons, Paul Marquis and his wife Beth and Gary Marquis and his wife Angie, all of...
text:
Van Buren \- Philip J. Marquis, 79, passed away unexpectedly Friday, May 29,
2020, while in the arms of his loving wife. Phil was born April 29, 1941, in
Van Buren, a son of the late George and Antoinette (Michaud) Marquis.

Phil worked at the former Jimmy's Foods, Van Buren, as a sales rep and truck
driver. His friendly demeanor, professionalism, pride in his product, and
abilities were well renowned throughout the St. John Valley and he made many
friends over his almost 30 years of sales and deliveries. He also spent
several years working for Van Buren Recycling, until his retirement in 2006.
Phil was an avid snowmobiler and, when there was no snow on the ground, would
tend to his gardens, spend time in the woods, or work the wood lots and
hayfields. An exceptional family man, Phil was a devoted husband, a loving
father, and he loved to attend many of his grandchildren's activities.

He is survived by his beloved wife of almost 55 years, Leona (Levesque)
Marquis of Van Buren; two sons, Paul Marquis and his wife Beth and Gary
Marquis and his wife Angie, all of Caribou; three siblings, Alice Parent of
Winslow, Louis Marquis and his wife Diane of E. Granby, CT, and John Marquis
and his wife Rebecca of W. Springfield, MA; four grandchildren, Michael,
Gabrielle, Sebastian and Samuel; and several nieces and nephews.

Relatives and friends are invited to a drive-through processional at 12:30 PM
on Thursday, June 11, 2020, at the family homestead, 222 Marquis Road, Van
Buren. A Mass of Christian Burial will be celebrated privately with his family
at St. Bruno-St. Remi Catholic Church. Burial will be in Grand River Cemetery.
In lieu of flowers, donations in Phil's name may be made to: Brian's Ride, c/o
Jefferson Cary Foundation, PO Box 89, Caribou, ME 04736\. Arrangements are a
service of Lajoie Funeral Home, 118 High St., Van Buren, Maine.

To share condolences online, please visit

[LajoieFuneralHome.com](http://LajoieFuneralHome.com)

title: Philip J. Marquis
html:
Van Buren - Philip J. Marquis, 79, passed away unexpectedly Friday, May 29, 2020, while in the arms of his loving wife. Phil was born April 29, 1941, in Van Buren, a son of the late George and Antoinette (Michaud) Marquis.

Phil worked at the former Jimmy's Foods, Van Buren, as a sales rep and truck driver. His friendly demeanor, professionalism, pride in his product, and abilities were well renowned throughout the St. John Valley and he made many friends over his almost 30 years of sales and deliveries. He also spent several years working for Van Buren Recycling, until his retirement in 2006. Phil was an avid snowmobiler and, when there was no snow on the ground, would tend to his gardens, spend time in the woods, or work the wood lots and hayfields. An exceptional family man, Phil was a devoted husband, a loving father, and he loved to attend many of his grandchildren's activities.

He is survived by his beloved wife of almost 55 years, Leona (Levesque) Marquis of Van Buren; two sons, Paul Marquis and his wife Beth and Gary Marquis and his wife Angie, all of Caribou; three siblings, Alice Parent of Winslow, Louis Marquis and his wife Diane of E. Granby, CT, and John Marquis and his wife Rebecca of W. Springfield, MA; four grandchildren, Michael, Gabrielle, Sebastian and Samuel; and several nieces and nephews.

Relatives and friends are invited to a drive-through processional at 12:30 PM on Thursday, June 11, 2020, at the family homestead, 222 Marquis Road, Van Buren. A Mass of Christian Burial will be celebrated privately with his family at St. Bruno-St. Remi Catholic Church. Burial will be in Grand River Cemetery. In lieu of flowers, donations in Phil's name may be made to: Brian's Ride, c/o Jefferson Cary Foundation, PO Box 89, Caribou, ME 04736. Arrangements are a service of Lajoie Funeral Home, 118 High St., Van Buren, Maine.

To share condolences online, please visit

LajoieFuneralHome.com
